Reviews.Title: “worst night sleep”
Reviews.Author: ajm3103
Reviews.Content: the hotel is you get what you pay for. there is 1 lift which is very small only 4 people (thin) can fit in it. our room was very basic and for the money we paid we did not mind that it was basic we was right next to lift but could not really hear it but we could hear the doors opening and closing. at night time we could hear what i think was the water tank filling up everytime someone used the water so this kept us awake most of the night, as well as the fan from the downstairs room. on the second day we got up for a shower and the water pressure was low and not much hot water and on our last day we had a drip of a shower. After ourfirst night we went out for the day and left quiet a bit of change on the side and when we came back house cleaning had been and the money had gone. the following day we left a few pence which they did not tuch. would not saty here again

Reviews.Title: “A true average but absolutely not bad!”
Reviews.Author: vilen
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a week. If you want true quality at average price – this is right choice. First you could benefit from convenient location – 15 min work from Paddington, 5 min to Bayswater metro station (central line), up 10 min to Kensington gardens. Even more there is a bus N23 that takes you directly to Oxford street and St. Pall. The room is small but acceptably clean. Breakfast is rather poor but you could bring some more with you. Very noisy at the weekends

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: bowersjo
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, just a few minutes from Bayswater "central". It's a small hotel, and it might look a bit dodgy when entering. Our room was in the basement, right opposite of the Breakfast Room. Although the hallway looked a bit run-down, the room was truly a surprise! It looked new and clean. A few cracked floorboards, but it didn't bother us. It was a bit stuffed when we first entered, but we just turned on the bathroom-fan and the air was clear in a couple of minutes. Great location, basic room - would recommend for travellers who'd like something cheap and do not plan to spend their vacation in their room.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad ...not too good”
Reviews.Author: Grapet01
Reviews.Content: Staff are efficient but can't be called friendly. I got a twin bedded 4th floor room which measured around 2.5m by 4m, with 3" beds (900mm). Colour TV with remote, tea and coffee making facilities, with a shower that emits a dribble of water. Room is budget so lots of stains etc and the bed has more lumps than the surface of the moon - this is my third night and yet to sleep good although very quiet street outside. Each floor plank has its own squeak and the door sounds like something from a gothic horror movie. Breakfast can be eaten from 7am and it is simple fare of cereal, toast, plus tea / coffee. Can be recommended for cheap no frills bed but that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let them book your taxi!”
Reviews.Author: miky7077
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just ok. Old, tiny rooms, not so clean (a lot of dust evrywhere). It's ok if your priority is to save money and see the city, as the position is very central. And of course, you get what you pay. An advice: Dont's ask them to book a taxi for you. I did it, and it was a rubbery. First of all, it was not a real taxi (it was a private driver who seemed to knew pretty well the staff of the hotel), and most of all he charged 14 pounds for a very little road (to Baker Street, that we reached in 5 minutes). So, book a taxi by yourself if you need it. And to the hotel staff, please remove all the dust.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money, great location”
Reviews.Author: singhera1
Reviews.Content: clean, adequate accommodation. We stayed overnight as a family of grown up children.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay compared to the price”
Reviews.Author: Feline75
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Wegdewood Hotel just a few weeks ago. Once again I was appalled by the bad reviews it had got (but at the same time bearing in mind that those reviews didn't probably hold much ground). Luckily I was correct. The place was completely satisfactory. I stayed there with a high school student group (of 22 people) for five nights. The rooms were tidy (no blood stains in the bed sheets), the bathrooms, albeit being small, were in excellent condition (no hairs). And who cares if the bathroom doors look like wardrobe doors as long as there are bathrooms in the rooms! Service at the reception desk wasn't overly eagerly but polite and prompt nonetheless. The breakfast was definitely of good value (once again compared to the price we were paying). It is irreplaceable if you can eat as much as you want (toast with jam) and drink as much as you want (orange juice, coffee or tea) and pay nothing extra. Keeping in mind the excellent location (just a few minutes’ walk from the Bayswater tube station, but anyway off the main road) and the excellent value for little money, I would definitely recommend the place for groups and friends. It might not be suitable for families with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Steer clear of this Hotel - it's deplorable ..”
Reviews.Author: Roger B
Reviews.Content: As soon as I saw the outside of this place I knew i had made a mistake. Upon checking in, they wanted pre payment for all 5 nights at which I refused until seeing the room. It was a disgrace and I immediately informed them i was staying for one night only. I was charged for 2 nights anyway and will dispute the charge. The staff were unfriendly, the room tiny and misrepresented on websites. I booked through Booking.com and have alerted them to this unfortunate visit.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvroamin
Reviews.Content: Hotel took payment for two nights as I arrived - I should have been warned and asked to see the room before paying. Room was filthy - bloody finger marks on the wall, filthy windows. I did not stay but was refused my money back. Booking.com said the second night would be cancelled. Hotel now refusing to refund second night and saying that I stayed there, which I did not. They are also saying that some of the photos I took are not of the room. They would appear to be both liars and cheats.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel: tiny room but good location”
Reviews.Author: lonaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over the weekend in peak tourist season; as I said the location is very convenient. We were lucky to get a room in the fourth floor, so the heat was bearable even with no air conditioning, and it was fairly clean. The room was really tiny though, and the bed could not be considered double. The bathroom was so small it looked like a closet, but the shower was ok. There was a TV (that we didn't use) a hair dryer and tea making facilities. A very low profile continental breakfast featuring instant coffee was included and was served in the basement- as it so often happens - in a room with no air.

Reviews.Title: “basic hotel but clean and convenient for London sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: alley999
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights whilst sightseeing the major attractions. Room very small but compact and comfortable. Two tube stations in close proximity. Our room looked out onto a lovely park. So nice to hear the birds chirping early morning. I would recommend for a short trip at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: Prj61
Reviews.Content: Room was beyond filthy, it was unsanitary. Blankets, sheets foul- stains, hair, etc. Looked like the set of a po..n shoot. Staff was belligerent, we saw room, and returned to lobby immediately to tell them we would be leaving, and the desk staff insisted we will be charged for the night anyway. We will be disputing this charge.

Reviews.Title: “nice neighbourhood and good service, funny rooms”
Reviews.Author: katti83 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: don´t use the lift.... the best was the wardrobe! open it and u will find the bathroom! silly but clean. would stay there again for the money we paid! area is great, close to portobello market.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE AVOID WEDGEWOOD HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Kenshin-X
Reviews.Content: This is probably the worst hotel I've stayed in. It deceives guests with an attractive cascade and posh surroundings. We were shocked by the room we are staying in. The blankets are stained and dirty. Upon opening the blankets, fine strands of body hair were all over the sheets. This was really unacceptable for what we were paying for. The furnitures are those you see in hostels, to be honest, I've seen hostels with better furnitures than this so called hotel. Needless to say, the toilet is self explanatory. To any potential guests, PLEASE AVOID THIS HOTEL at all costs. You deserve better with the money you're paying.

Reviews.Title: “Very dated but clean, good price & very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Brendonsmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights on a Christmas Shopping Trip. The room was tiny with 2 "put up beds", only sheet and blanket as bedding, very dated furniture, TV & deco. The bathroom looked like a wardrobe but on the whole it was clean, had a strong detergent smell. The Window had padlocked bars which was a little unnerving in case of fire. For us it was sufficient we simply wanted somewhere to lay our heads after a hard days shopping! The Breakfast is simply toast and cereal which again was sufficient. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Not as bad as some reviews on here but not that great either, needs updating.

Reviews.Title: “Average room, horrible blankets”
Reviews.Author: JFK8
Reviews.Content: Typical: great lobby with marble floors, the rooms less grand. My room was spacious enough, with two beds. It smelled of very strong detergent, not particularly nice, but better than smoke or something like that I presume. The bed had really horrible blankets (even with 2 blankets it was cold). I advice you to skip breakfast because what they serve should not be allowed to be called food (tip: go to the French coffeehouse on the corner of Garway Road and Westbourne Grove) .

Reviews.Title: “i would not class this hotel as 1 star could not stay 1 night walked out .”
Reviews.Author: welshgirl055
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel through booking agency called quick book which iwould not recommend.I expected basic for what we paid but cant even call this basic. we had 2 put u up beds and the bathroom was in what looked like a cupboard, walls had dirty marks all over and the carpet had stains all over in fact it was so bad that my husband and i walked out we could not stay there and landed payin out for another hotel for the 2 nights but there was no way we were staying in such a seedy hotel. please take my advise and dont stay at this hotel it is worth paying extra for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what it is...”
Reviews.Author: mkmidthun
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice reception, but the receptionist were anything but friendly. They weren't un-friendly, they just never looked at us or acknowledged our presence as they were too busy with Facebook. We stayed in a quad room, and it was TINY. It consisted of two 'double' beds however we could barely fit two in one bed - and we are slim people! Furthermore the decor (or lack thereof) is ancient, there were stains and cracks all over the walls, and the window was covered in huge bars so we had trouble opening it - how can 4 people sleep in one room without having the window open?? I had trouble locating the bathroom as I saw no door in our bedroom - but it was behind two closet-looking doors which could not be closed properly, let alone locked. The bathroom was clean, but tiny. The shower was terrible, and it took me about half an hour to get the shampoo out of my hair. We paid approximately £90 per person per night including 'breakfast' (white bread, jam, cornflakes) and this was supposedly a lower rate as the tour operator I work with sells this hotel. I think it was way too expensive and crap value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what was expected for the price...”
Reviews.Author: DRFCNath
Reviews.Content: Don't really know what all these terrible reviews are about... they aren't being fair with the hotel at all. Only stopped for two nights, and with the cheap stay compared to many other hotels in the area it's just what you'd expect. basic. The hotel is in a tremendous location in a really nice area and was perfect for the purpose of the trip. Rooms were basic, TV, double bed, hair dryer, wardrobe etc... the shower room and toilet worked fine and were clean, and even though it was small there can be no complaints. as i said before its exactly what was expected for the price so for all the people that are moaning - don't expect too much again if you're gonna be tight!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmj1096
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this hotel!! The online booking advised a quadruple room with 2 singles and 1 double bed, the room contained 2 doubles. I traveled with 2 of my girlfriends for my birthday weekend. From the begining the stay was awful, the receptionist couldn't even give proper directions to our room. When we asked to be moved or why our room wasn't as advertised we were told that was all they had. Upon later inspection of the room and adult toy was located on top of the furniture. Our window opened into a storage area off the kitchen and there was no ventilation. The next morning we told the day receptionist the problem, she got us another cot for the room and told us it was the best room they had and that it was new as well. Breakfast consisted of toast, dry cereal, tea, coffee and OJ, paltry offering cinsidering we paid $360 for two nights. We were offered no other conpensation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: johnjaemson
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed at the Wedgewood for a few nights and were a bit concerned about the reviews but having stayed there i was pleasently surprised! The hotel is in a great location, right beside hyde park. The rooms were clean and nice. I had a great time in london and would come back to the Wedgewood on my next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “This is poor quality hostel accommodation behind an attractive facade.”
Reviews.Author: Lesley027
Reviews.Content: I'm amazed to read that some people found this hotel acceptable. Of greatest concern to me are the potential risks in this building. On each floor there is a narrow, 'rabbit warren' of corridors on which it proved difficult to pass someone with luggage. The stairs are twisting, steep and narrow in places and pose a major hazard to anyone who may have the misfortune to trip on them. The narrow corridors and tiny single rooms are, at the very least, unpleasant for anyone with even the slightest degree of claustrophobia. I would be particularly frightened to be in this building in the event of a fire! The single rooms are scarcely more than cupboards and the beds are child size, metal frame camp beds. The cheap furniture is very badly battered, the curtains stained and the bedcovers torn. The one towel supplied per person, smelled heavily as though it had been dried near food. The one tiny lift which could only hold 2 people or one with luggage, is shabby and the carpet in it is worn into holes. On the 4th floor there is graffiti on the wall outside the lift door. The "continental" breakfast which is served in a little room in the basement, consists of corn flakes, bran flakes, sliced white bread for toasting, butter, jams, tea bags, instant coffee, milk and orange juice. The description of this hotel on the website is highly misleading. It is true that it is in a great location and that the outside, small entrance and reception areas are very attractive. However, beyond that, the experience is very different. The three rooms which I saw were of poor hostel standard. The prices charged were exorbitant and clearly the proprietors were capitalising on the lack of availability of proper hotel accommodation in London during Wimbledon fortnight.

Reviews.Title: “NICE”
Reviews.Author: sofia239
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the wedgewood with 2 friend we got triple room in 3th floor, the room was nice and clean, the staff was verry friendly and helpfull location was exellent, i will come back on my next holiday to the wedgewood hotel defanetlly, i want to say thank you to the staff for the help

Reviews.Title: “Cosy”
Reviews.Author: Josie31
Reviews.Content: I hadn't read the reviews until after I'd booked it so was of course expecting somewhere terrible but in fact I was pleasantly surprised. I found the staff very friendly and helpful, the room was very clean, as was the shower, location was perfect, and the breakfast was ample. To sum up, for the price it was very good. I would definitley go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: Cakelina
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed for three nights. I started no get big, itchy bites on my body and woke up in the nigth feeling something crawling on me. Had no idea what it was but was in agony, the bites itched terribly and got infected. When we got home we went on the internet and realised it was bedbugs! We called a company that specializes in these things and they confirmed that it must have been bedbugs. How disgusting. We were terrified they might have even spread to our house through our luggage but that fortunately did not happen, as we kept the bags in the washingroom. I still have red, ugly scars from the bites and they even show on my weddingphotos... :-( I read another rewiev on this hotel that mentioned bedbugs as well. I don´t think there´s anything more to say. Unless that i hope it will never happen to me again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: joeybella
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks nice from the outside but looks can be deceiving! The lift can barely hold two people and half the time it doesn't even work. The rooms are worse then the crappiest motel 6 rooms!! the door has a push lock, not reliable at all. When you leave you have to give your key to the front desk people, now that's fine but here's where it is all bad... when you come back you just tell them you room number and they hand over the keys without even checking ID. We were supposed to stay there for two nights but the first night my friends and I were too afraid to sleep, at one point I swear someone was trying to open our door. So we pushed a chair to the door and piled all of our luggage on top of the chair. We were seriously considering moving our beds to the door. By the way the beds are worse then roll away beds. The shower water smelled really bad. I have never in my entire life stayed at such a horrible place before! A note to any one considering staying at this place: Beware! It's dangerous and scary. pay the extra bucks and stay at a clean place where you know you'll be safe. We actually checked out the next morning and when confronted with the front desk clerk, she didn't even pretend to be suprised that we were leaving. She knew what a crappy place that hotel was!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: travelernycNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is an nice place to stay. The room was clean and the staff friendly. Great location really close to oxford st. Would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Behind the Facade”
Reviews.Author: jonred
Reviews.Content: Very small shaky lift, corridors very narrow, kettle on dangerous shelf, not proper beds (folding camp bed ), toilet behind double wardrobe doors that did not close, terrible shower hardly any spray, drain blocked so shower tray fills up and floods the floor, no bath mat supplied. Terrible value for the money charged.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Boy!”
Reviews.Author: randomEX123
Reviews.Content: I knew I was going to be in London for only one or two days and didn't want to spend a lot of money on a room and yet wanted to get something close to Paddington. But oh boy. I arrived late and the person at the reception was watching TV. He was rather annoyed that I had interrupted his show and not very happily gave me a key for a room downstairs. The room was damp and had a really funny smell. It was rather large for only one person. The bathroom was old and the light very very dim. Carpets had stains all over. The funny thing was a rather large window on the side of the room. It was high enough so you couldn't see too much thru it. So I thought I was going to get some light during the day (well, "light" as for London standards). At around 5:30AM, I realized that my "sunny window" was in fact an internal window and on the other say it was the kitchen! So the russian/polish ladies preparing breakfast for the whole hotel started making pots and pans noisy.. and that was the end of my sleep :-( Later on I found another hotel one block from Paddington a *lot* better than this one for a little bit less too... so my suggestion: try finding something a bit better around Paddington and about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An unfriendly and old hotel”
Reviews.Author: VasiliosF
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. The morning reception lady was very unfriendly and the breakfast was terrible, especially the white bread. The twin room was quite small, with uncomfortable single beds, old dirty carpets and crackling wooden floor.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and good hotel, great location, not for people that want luxury”
Reviews.Author: Naps2008
Reviews.Content: Wedgewood is a very cheap hotel (we booked through an agency), so we didn't expect luxury. We actually got exactly what we expected: clean rooms, a good shower, a simple breakfast. The building is old, it hasn't been maintained very well, but it's charming in that: old windows and doors. The location is perfect: the street is quiet, and it's very close to the subway that's located on a street full of little restaurants and shops. I'd stay at the place again.

Reviews.Title: “OMG (in a bad way)”
Reviews.Author: Daniel16
Reviews.Content: The room was small, the closets were dirty, the bathroom was so tiny you couldn't close the door when sitting on the toilet, the beds were terrible (and I can sleep practically anywhere), etc etc I thought the hotel wouldn't matter that much when visiting London, so I booked the cheepest thing I could find. I was wrong... Next time, I'll spend more on the hotel (and it certainly won't be this one).

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, rotten, unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: HotelManager02
Reviews.Content: The worst Hotel I ever seen in my life. I was in London for the WTM and I reserved this Hotel without saying that I am manager in two Hotels in Florence. During my three days stay tehy never changed the sheets of the bed, never cleaned the bathroom, the wardrobe was small and dirty, the bed was broken and so close to the broken window that rain coming inside the room was wetting me two nights on three. At the arrival I asked for some more soap and towels and I think the night portier while he was watching televisione lying on a sofa with his feet without shoes put on a small table, answered me that this was not possible as the policy of the hotel is to give just one small soap and one small towel to Clients The breakfast room is a small and dirty room on a basement. The personnel did not ask you anything. It seems you are a ghost and not a guest. Do not go there. Take care of my review.

Reviews.Title: “shite!”
Reviews.Author: angusstevenson
Reviews.Content: I have never seen so many depressed tourists...and i was one of them! I got suckered by false advertsing 'tasteful rennovation.' Perhaps Ali, the manager of this (---------)thought 'tasteful' included ripped carpet, curtains pulled from the rail, skirting boards missing, stains on the bed covers...or perhaps by 'rennovations' he meant the black marks on the walls caused by annoyed residents' boots as they relaised they've been done in good and proper. We're forwarding a complaint along with photos we took. Recommend everyone else does the same.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Bolowski
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite possibly the worst hotel we have ever stayed in and I would NEVER recommend anyone to stay here. Our experience put a complete dampner on our weekend in London. The first room we were shown was tiny and consisted of two temporary camp beds covered in scratchy brown blankets. We had booked a double so we asked to be moved. The lift was broken on the way down and so we had to cart all our stuff downstairs. The second room was no better. The curtain was falling down, the carpet scruffed, two double temporary camp beds this time still with the same scratchy brown blankets that were covered in stains, the door to the bathroom was broken, there were black marks all over the walls, the tap in the bathroom was broken and the room was tiny. I have never been so upset with a hotel booking. We reported our concerns to the receptionist on duty but she said it was a 2 star hotel and that was standard. This hotel is nowhere near a 2 star hotel. Ive stayed in much nicer youth hostels for a fraction of the price. Outside in the corridors the carpets were scuffed up and coming apart on the stairs and there was a general shabby decline everywhere. Breakfast was a basic continental breakfast only and there were not enough tables for all those wanting breakfast. We paid £79 for the night and I can honeslty say it was the worst £79 ive ever spent.

Reviews.Title: “Wished I had read reviews before I booked”
Reviews.Author: dancingqueen93
Reviews.Content: Big mistake booking here, not worth taking low budget hotel before reading some reviews, only good point is the location but everything else is awful, rooms and breakfast is a joke!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice,friendly, close to the centre”
Reviews.Author: blowdolphin
Reviews.Content: the recepionist was kind and friendly, located in centre of the town, standard english room and bed

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Wedgewood Hotel. Not good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: emishir
Reviews.Content: When we checked in at Wedgewood Hotel, the receptionist was really cold and really not friendly at all. The room was extemely small and the bathroom too. The bedspread was very very dirty. It had stains on it, hair left from previous people who used it and it also smelt terrible. We stayed at Wedgewood for three nights. We were in the fourth floor and for most of the time the lift was not working. When we reported this to the receptionist she just shrugged her shoulders. Imagine for most of the time we had to go up to the fourth floor by stairs with all the shopping bags. I would not recommend this hotel as it literally has a poor service, lack of cleanliness as well as the rooms need a make over. Emily

Reviews.Title: “I thought the reviews were exaggerating”
Reviews.Author: Hutton
Reviews.Content: I thought the reviews were going a bit overboard. I have stayed in London before and know that the rooms are small according to North American standards. This hotel is awful. I thought I can deal with this for a couple of nights, but 2 sleepless nights were the result. The location of the hotel is great, but the rooms were so disgusting. I'm usually a person that travels with an open mind, I checked in and thought the lobby doesn't look too bad. I had read the reviews. My room was as bad as the other reviews said. There were stains on the carpet, black mold on the ceiling of the bathroom, my window was locked from the floor to the ceiling, everything just seemed old and very dirty. I asked at the front desk about the locked bars on the window, I was told there was a special key. So in the event of a fire, I guess I would have been toast (pardon the punn). The happy news is. I was able to find a hotel for the end of my stay right around the corner from this hotel. The price was a bit higher, but not much. It was heaven in comparison. The name of the hotel is the umi Hotel and it is literally on the next street over. It seemed a world away. Don't spend your money at the Wedgewood - go around the corner to the umi.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It To Yourself!!”
Reviews.Author: QueensNewYork
Reviews.Content: I would NOT RECOMMEND this hotel to anyone!!! The rooms were filthy and had bugs that bit me terribly. The bathroom was unsanitary in my opinion and very small. The shower curtain had mildew all over it and we asked for a new one, but did not hear from anyone during our 3 day stay. The towels were shabby and furniture/fixtures worn out. The entire hotel needs a facelift and leaves much to be desired. Not to mention there was a serious leak in the lobby coming out of the recessed lighting of the hotel during our stay, but only towels were put down to catch the water on the floor. The lifts did not always work and the staff was not very accomodating, although 1-2 tried. We even came in late one night to find the desk person sleeping. The breakfast room is okay, but be forewarned, they only serve cold cereal, sliced bread and instant coffee/tea. Who serves instant coffee in a hotel? Thank God we did not spend much time in the room. For the inexpensive price, I would not even encourage anyone to stay there even if their budget depended on it. Please look elsewhere. The only saving grace was location. It was accessible to the tube and the buses. Other than that...DON'T DO IT TO YOURSELF!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Daggio
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, we do not recommend this hotel to any tarveller. This is what we say to all of you, do not get seduced by the apparently inexpensive rates, there is a reason why it is so cheap: it is bad. The rooms, bathrooms and beds are small -that is if you get the bed size you actually asked for. Not only is everything very small, nothing seems to be clean. Carpets and bed linen show their age. There are no hangers in the closets. The TV does not have a good signal. This is not to mention the smell of the room. What would you think of a hotel in which the windows have been barred? The area is great. It is close to all the amenities, to the parks (Kensington, Hyde and St Jame's) and has good transport links but... there are other hotel in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Travel_2_Norway
Reviews.Content: I would not believe the pictures on the web. They are lying. Pictures give an impression of nice, not to small rooms and a nice place to eat. We rented a quadruple room, and this was placed in the basement. We could not see out, and the smell of muggy basement was importunate. The bed sheets felt moisty when going to bed, and the bedspread had stains. The room had severe water damages, and there was cobweb in the roof corner. One of the beds lacked two of the horizontal bars in the end, so the mattress fell through the bed. We asked to have it replaced, just to discover in the evening that they had just turned the bed around. So instead of the head part falling through the bed, now the legs were falling through. The ad also tells there is a TV on the room. Yes, there is, but you need to pay £5 to get the remote controller. There was only one member of the staff where I could see a smile in the face, actually she was very friendly and worked in the reception. The rest seemed grumpy. It felt like they didn't like to work there.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor”
Reviews.Author: chhr
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was not clean. I woke up to find the insects on my bed!!! Very uncomfortable and I left the hotel for the airport without having breadkfast. I think it was good so because the other comments say the breadkfast was awful. This hotel ruined my stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kitesurfer07
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent four horrendous nights at this appallingly unhygienic "hotel", during which, we shared our twin "campbeds" with several bed bugs! Initially, we contemplated sleeping on the floor, but noticing how dirty the carpet was, we concluded that this might have been more bug infested than the beds! The mattresses were extremely thin, and the pillows heavily stained and very old. Blankets on the beds were dirty and stained also. A TV was provided, although very tatty, and a broken ceiling light-fitting hung down precariously overhead. It was evident that the "room cleaning service" didn't include washing out our used cups, and did not replace the toilet rolls. In fact, on arrival at our room, we noticed that we had not been left any toilet rolls, and despite the hotel profile, there was no telephone in the room either! A couple of friends of ours who were also staying there at the same time, were bitten by bed-bugs, which have been sent away for analysis before making a formal complaint to the hotel owner. This establishment is an absolute disgrace and should be shut down immediately on the grounds of health and safety!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid !”
Reviews.Author: AtinaCroatia
Reviews.Content: Family from Croatia . We spend 5 night in hotel , and every day get towels with stain . That was the worst experience there .I could stand broken curtains, cracked furniture and paint on the wall,dirty floor, blankets from my grandmother,broken TV cable,horrible toilet flush...But you must have strong nerves to take a shower in that bath and dry yourself with that towels.First day I ask them to change them but I get equal dirty. Sheets was clean, for wonder. We pay in advance to travel agency otherwise we would not stay neither one day. And a price is not low .Only good thing is location.

Reviews.Title: “It's a no go!”
Reviews.Author: JourneyplannerES
Reviews.Content: On first sight you think the Wedgewood is alright if you're on a tight budget. But when staying there you soon find out that it's a complete disaster: ignorant, complaining staff, who think you're a complete nut when putting a complaint. They think of this ramshackle as Buckingham Palace, but it's a complete dump! A non smoking hotel, but the nighporter smokes cannabis! Creaking floors and staircases, dirty bathrooms, broken down curtains: you name it, they've got it. I wouldn't stay there again even if they offered me a room for free. Ten room 111: you would'nt put a dog in there!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: lady17
Reviews.Content: Its only advantage is location - only 7 min walking to the nearest tube station. It is located in an old building, clearly underinvested (although I was told that two upper floors were being renovated so it may get improved in the future). I have worked in hotel business for a few years so I know you can compensate some disadvantages with two things, basic I would say: cleanness and quality of service. Undortunately none of these worked at the Wedgewood. Our tripple room was located on the ground floor with a view to...rubbish heap (old leaves put in plastic bags left in so called terrace plus lots of other waste). So called "tea facilities" were of no use: cups left on a dusty shelf, kettle dirty inside. One part of the curtains was just hanging loose. The window could not be open at all. The bathroom...you cannot really move around when inside. Toilet flashing system was not working properly. I have passed all my remarks to the receptionists but they were completely ignorant. Nothing has changed for 4 nights we have spent there. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!!!! Although the price was good, I woudl rather spend more and feel comfortable at the place I stay.

Reviews.Title: “FOR BUDGET TRAVEL "ONLY"”
Reviews.Author: DesiReporter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is " NOT FOR YOU " if: - You like to come back to the hotel to relax after the day - This is your romantic vaccation - You are on your honeymoon - You like clean rooms and bathrooms - You like mid size rooms Stay here if: - You are on a tight budget - You are on a budget and come back to the hotel to sleep only - Don't have any expectation from the hotel room Other facts: - No phones in the room - Rooms furniture is OLD - Bathrooms are very small and in bad condition (see pics) - Rooms are very small

Reviews.Title: “Rathole with Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: rayw1
Reviews.Content: The best thing that can be said for this hotel was that there were no rats - any self respecting rat had already left. The room we were initially given was teeny tiny - approx 8 feet by 10 feet. There is no air conditioning which meant leaving the window open to avoid the stifling summer heat. The room overlooked a gated park, but this meant the locals played cricket under the window until it was too dark (10PM) and then they continued drinking until early morning. The bathroom facilities were abysmal - cramped and not working. The metal shower lead was broken causing the water flow to be constricted, requiring you to hold the shower head below your knees to get any water at all. The following morning we found critters in the bed and in our towels. The receptionist, although English fluent on arrival, became less understanding on presentation of the bedbugs. She pretended to not know what they were and couldn't offer any idea of when the room could be cleaned. We were transferred to another room for the next 4 days, which was a double (featured in the hotel photo above the front door entry). While this room was bigger, and didn't appear to have bedbugs, the position of the room over the Square meant putting up with residents in the hotels across the street talking and yelling until 2AM most mornings. This hotel is a disgrace to honest hoteliers and should be shut down by the Health department. Avoid at all costs!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival with my husband and young daughter, some confusion over payment although check debited from account a week earlier. No confirmation received by letter or e-mail before we arrived although both were requested. They then asked for my credit card details which I was loathe to provide as payment had already been made. The lobby initially did not look too bad but upon closer inspection I started to have doubts before we saw the room. We had booked a triple and found it to be most unsatisfactory. We might as well have slept on park benches because that's what the "camp" beds felt like. The shower room and toilet were cramped, the toilet did not flush properly and I certainly was not going to have a shower, as it was not clean. We had booked for 2 nights, but I was not prepared to stay more than one, so we checked out much to the recpetionists dismay the following morning.

Reviews.Title: “basic but ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely great value for money. The staff do not speak much English but were very friendly. The room was basic but comfortable on the whole. They allow smoking in the rooms, which I don't approve of. The bathrooms are tiny but do the job. Come here if you want a base for sleep and breakfast but not for an experience of hotel life.

Reviews.Title: “A Place to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for five nights over the Christmas holiday. The shower had very little water pressure. And the restroom water pressure was also very low. THe front desk receptonist was not very friendly. But the price was not bad,and I went to England for sightseeing, not for hotel life. I recommend it just if you need a place to sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disgrace. First there were intial problems about the tpye of room which i booked over the internet; i booked a double and i was given a twin. Then within 10 minutes of being in the bed my friend and myself were bitten by bugs. We found 2 bugs in the bed with us and on closer inspection of the headboard found many more and a nest behind the headboard. We complained and were told there was nothing that could be done and they refused to refund the money. They also refused to come and see the bug nest. Eventually after much argument we were found another room which appeared to be bug free. Trying to follow up a complaint with the hotel has been unsuccessful - they deny point blank that the bed has bugs - i still have 2 of the bugs ( dead!) which we took as souvenir proof! I suggest that if you have to stay here you take a can of raid and debug the room first.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent, with loads of places to eat and shop. We had a room with view, which was overlooking the park - it compensated the fact that the room was smallish. i suppose it is the average london hotel room size. pleasant staff. i love the fact it had a yellow pages in the room. inspired!

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty!!”
Reviews.Author: PatricitaPepa
Reviews.Content: we stayed 3 nights cause we dont have enough money, it is very poor , the room is old and dirty, also the lobby, the breakfast is terrible , be carefull.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and depressing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I do not have high standards for hotels in London, but this place is seriously lacking in absolutely everything. I will not complain about the tiny television, the constant noise, the lame breakfast and lack of the space in the room because these problems are found in many London (budget) hotels. I will mention the awful service and lack of cleanliness though because it was appalling. We notified the hotel twice beforehand that we'd be checking in around 11pm and they insisted that this would be fine. Upon arrival, the front door was locked and the man who came to open it was clearly not expecting anyone. He took 30 minutes to check us in, asking for our credit card at least three times. Just when we thought he was done, he stopped what he was doing at the computer and turned around to watch the Jackie Chan movie playing on the lobby television. We actually had to say, "Excuse me...." to shake him out of his trance. Then we got to the room and it was a single - one little bed and a side table. So back down we went to argue with the man, who insisted the room he gave us was in fact a triple. Finally, but very reluctantly, he took our word for it and then he set about to find us another room which took at least another half an hour. In the end we got a triple room, which was completely unsatisfactory. Not only were there stains on the blankets, but the floor was also filthy. We had to wash our own glasses because the housecleaning staff would simply ignore them. We tried everything - we put them in front of the door, on the bed, next to the toilet - but every night we came back and they were sitting unwashed in the exact same place. The toilet never flushed and they refused to replace our toilet paper even though housecleaning came in our room every day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I rented a "triple" room at the Wedgewood and we were very pleased with it. The room is small and the bathroom is even smaller, but it was serviceable. The area is quiet and extremely close to the tube station, and there's a mall down the street with a few nice restaurants and a movie theater. We felt very safe walking around late at night (in a group). If you're getting up early, you'll get a hot (almost too hot) shower, but if you get up after 9, you'll only get tepid water. I would probably stay in this hotel again, given the chance.

HotelInfo.Name: Wedgewood Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 49-51 Leinster Square | Bayswater, Westminster, London W2 4PR, England
